comments.text: Overall a nice spot, have waited twice in two weeks here for around 15min and got a straight ride to Tallinn.
Awesome spot. Bus stop after a crossroad with speed camera. If you get hungry, go to the bar, it's cheap as hell and awesome.
For those who like to ask at petrol stations, olerex is way more popular and better spot than alexela, just a heads up :)

The ultimate best spot on Tallinn-Tartu highway if headed to Tallinn, nice bus station, as well as speeding up lane however there is speed camera at 50km/h area so everyone is extra slow, never have i waited here for more than 10 minutes, with average ride coming within 2-3 minutes

Good spot to catch cars/trucks out of the ferry, there's space to stop and entrance to a parking. If you come in the Viking Line you will have time to catch at least the last half of the vehicles heading out. Got a truck almost all the way to Riga. Solo female, in the middle of a storm, sign Latvia.
Got lucky after just 5 min when I got from the ferry :) Got out of city and from there on to Pärnu in 2 rides.

Good spot indeed. There is a parking lot for the trucks, you can ask there. Found a truck to Poland and asked for a ride - no problem. Although most of the drivers stop just past the Polish border because it's forbidden to them to drive longer  than 11 hours (or something) on one day. But they will ask on the radio if somebody is going further. There is a second spot on the other side of the port. The Tallink ships are arriving there and they do that a lot more often than the Viking ships.

Whenever a ship of EckerÃ¶ Lines or Viking Lines arrives, there is a large amount of trucks passing past this point on their way from Finland to Europe. You are likely to get a ride at least to southern Lithuania from here. Especially good if you've just come by a ship yourself. The Tallink ships bring elsewhere, maybe someone else can mark where to wait for trucks that have used them. For ships' timetables, check the ship companies' websites.

Towards Puhja/Viljandi, been here in Märja bus stop quite some times, usually you'll get a rather local going car but there's quite some long distance drivers here as well. Bus stop itself is decent, large enough for cars to stop, you can get here with the bus nr 11(Õssu). Wait times of 10-30 minutes expected
Today a straight ride to Pärnu!
Took a bus to here from the city centre and then slowly started my way from here towards our island Saaremaa.
got a direct ride to pärnu. cars go slow behind the roundabout
theres a nice road side spot just behind a round about - use it if youre trying to get to parnu!
Best spot from Pärnu to Tallinn, will work any season or time, wait time 20 at daytime, 40 minutes at nighttime
Very good stop. All cars heading to Tallin are going through here and they have plenty space to stop. Got a ride by a truck driver all the way to Tallinn.
Excellent spot. Small roundabout, cars exit very slowly. Good shoulder to wait on for cars going East or South (Viljandi or Tartu).
New roundabout is good for going towards Kilingi-Nõmme, wait time 10-30 minutes
Got a straight ride to Räpina from here. :)
Got picked up very fast on a Friday afternoon.

Towards Elva/Tartu. Like said before, the spot itself is very small, just barely enough to have a car stop there, but due to just the right amount of traffic and very slow speeds, you will catch a car within 20 minutes, as well as it has good street lights for the dark
Not much space to stop, but cars go slow and will pick you up anyway towards Tartu
Got a lift directly to Virtsu harbour, even though it was already dark outside. Good spot, as it has street lights!
Good spot for Lihula direction, not the best visibility at nighttime but it's 70 km/h area, wait time 15-40 minutes depending on the time of the year and day/darktime
Caught a ride fast to the harbour of Virtsu.
Towards Virtsu, good visibility, try to aim for the cars coming on the road 10 tho, since most cars use different road when going there than 60. Wait time of 10-15 minutes
Many trucks going to the Eastern Europe. Quite easy to get a ride!
Got here a lift to Helsinki, very good spot. But imporant is to check before when ship gonna leave the port and start hitchhiking(or asking drivers) like 20-30 minutes before.
bus stop direction Tartu. found a direct ride there.

There's actually a bus stop in here, really wide and speeds are slow here, great for going southbound, a lot of local traffic, you might even catch someone just going to their datcha turning couple hundred meters south away from road, so be aware of that, otherwise it's good spot, waiting times of 5-20 minutes
got a direct ride to Haapsalu from one od the first cars that passed by but i think i just got lucky
Uncomfy spot for drivers but always got a ride pretty fast, direction Lihula, wait time 10 minutes
Most ideal hitchhiking spot imaginable. A lot of traffic and a speeding camera in middle of the crossroad so the traffic is all 50km/h and everyone can turn easily into the bus stop.
Towards Tartu, another really great spot but harder during nighttime, wait times around 10-40 minutes
First car stopped. Two lovely local boys took me to the bigger road that goes from Pärnu to Viljandi/Tartu.
Even we have been there at midnight so there wasn't much traffic, we got a ride to Riga.

Even though it doesn't look that promising the spot just keeps delivering, lots of traffic to Latvia and Lithuania and somehow they always stop here within 10-20 minutes, in itself it's just a bus stop and not many cars turning from Linnavere road

I got the first car here to Riga ! He took me only 25 km ! But still I think here is the best stop for HH to Riga ! Just take a bus from the city center to arrive here for 1.75 euros I don't remember the number ! But you can see in Google maps

Towards Muuga/Viimsi/Pirita, nice bus stop which truth be told isn't the largest but does the job, place has streetlights and due to it being basically in Tallinn would have 24/7 traffic, try to make sure the car stopping goes the direction you want, wait times of 10-20 minutes expected

Towards Aovere, but a lot of the cars taking this exit actually usually go quite some long distance (Mustvee/Jõhvi/Jõgeva/Tallinn etc). The turn itself isn't the best, not the most amount of room but you will be able to stop anything due to the low speeds, don't be hesitated about most cars staying on Tartu-Räpina highway, try to aim cars coming from Räpina direction - those are the long distance ones, wait times of 15-45 minutes expected
Towards Narva, people coming from datchas head almost certainly to Narva, good enough density of cars and friendly people which almost guarantees you a ride, wait times of 5-20 minutes expected
Towards Auvere, railroad crossing so people slow down, good visibility, wait times of 10-20 minutes here

Towards Jõhvi, very good spot with long speeding up lane for the cars from Sillamäe, lots of traffic and 70km/h area, try to aim for the cars turning, has street lights, wait times of 5-10 minutes expected
Towards Narva, good traffic density, bus stop still in 70km/h area and good visibility, wait times of 10-20 minutes expected
Towards Narva, bus stop with decent size, cars go also in average motorway speeds, no cars from Toila turn here so concentrate on cars from highway, wait times of 10-20 minutes expected
Another very good bus stop towards Tartu, decent traffic, has street lights and wide enough, wait times of 20-40 minutes expected

Towards Tartu, great spot, low speeds due to roundabout, a lot of cars headed towards Tartu especially in the mornings, has street lights and the bus stop is huge, you can stop anything there, wait times of 5-30 minutes expected depending on the time of the day
Towards Jõhvi, not the most amount of space but speeds are low enough for cars to stop, can try both - cars on highway and cars turning, wait times of 5-20 minutes expected
Convenient speeding up lane and bus stop for Tõrva direction, decent traffic, try to aim for the cars coming from Kuigatsi road, wait times of 5-20 minutes expected

Towards Rõngu/Valga, loads of traffic but due to the build of this road you have to hitch on the turning lane before the actual turn so you can't hitch local cars, but as a positive there is very good visibility for the cars that are already on the highway and as the lane is very long it's comfortable for them to stop, wait times of 5-15 minutes expected

Towards Elva or Pangodi road or Kintsli road, most cars from Peedu go to Elva and if you can't be bothered to walk there you can just thumb the cars here, low speeds and people will understand you most likely just want to go to Elva, wait times of 5-15 minutes expected
Towards Haaslava/Roiu, decent amount of traffic, not the best place to stop as no wide shoulder, but cars coming from roundabout have low speeds, wait times of 5-15 minutes expected
Sunday evening got a straight ride to Tartu. A nice shoulder for cars to stop.

Towards Haapsalu, you can try to hitch cars turning from Kooli tee, Hansuküla tee etc when you are walking towards the Linnamäe bus station spot , as most locals around here are very friendly as well as they would anyways head to Haapsalu, uncomfortable for cars to stop but the town has speeds of 50km/h all through it and not that much traffic so cars could end up stopping anywhere, wait times of 5-30 minutes
Towards Tartu, pretty good bus stop, try to aim for cars coming from Osula, quite some of them go long distance, wait times of 5-20 minutes expected

Towards Väimela/Võru, rather uncomfortable area as speeds are at 90km/h and there is no real spot around here to stop but due to just about the right amount of density of the traffic, cars are likely to stop, loads of locals going between Põlva and Võru, wait times of 10-25 minutes expected
Towards Mooste, decent amount of traffic, city limits so slow speeds, good visibility, expected wait times of 10-30 minutes
Towards Rõngu/Valga, very good speeding up lane, loads of room and good visibility, would rather be here than in the bus stop, wait times of 5-15 minutes expected
Tried hitchhiking from more the city side and that was nice as well, the lady was very nice and took me to Kehtna manor where I wanted to do geocaching hehe.

This bus stop is doable for pretty much any direction going out from Viljandi; Holstre/Mustla; Karksi/Karksi-Nuia; Kilingi-Nõmme/Pärnu. Quite some long distance drivers try to avoid Viljandi and thus will go around it, so pretty good odds of getting a car longer distance, if you head towards Pärnu or Karksi, ask for Laidu tee and hitch from there if they go towards Holstre. Bus stop itself has pretty decent visibility, and wide enough, wait times of 5-20 minutes expected

Towards Puhja/Tartu, more likely to stop a car going to Tartu, an alternative and a good spot for my liking when it's already very dark outside, as Elva has very good street lighting, as well as cars go in slow speeds, before turning to the highway, wait times of 10-30 minutes expected, most cars here go to Tartu so ideal for that

Towards Puhja/Viljandi, a very nice turning lane for cars coming from Rõhu as well as very good visibility for the cars already on the main road, a lot of space and good amount of traffic, wait times of 5-15 minutes expected
Towards Ilmatsalu, good spot, comfortable enough to stop cars fast, loads of traffic turn away nearby but a ride to Ilmatsalu should be doable within 5-15 minutes
Really good spot. You can be clearly seen by drivers, and there is a lot of space to stop. I got a ride with a really nice guy all the way to Tallinn.
Straight ride to Lihula from here.
Not many cars, but got a straight ride to Pärnu from here.
Asked around in the line of cars waiting for the ferry. Most of them were driving towards Tallinn/Harjumaa, but then found a car driving to Tartu through Pärnu.
Asked the cars waiting in the line for the ferry to take me to the centre of Muhu island, but can easily find people going to Saaremaa.
Enough space to stop for cars going towards Lihula/Virtsu.
Not a lot of traffic but the first one stopped.
Caught a ride fast from Rapla to Märjamaa.
Caught a ride with one of the cars coming from Saaremaa Rally to Keila.
Hitched a ride quickly to the centre of Tallinn in the dark. There was light there so it was alrighty.

Caught a ride with a Ukrainian man on a Polish truck, who was driving from Jõhvi to Warsaw. It was very nice and warm in his truck after a long and wet hike in the bog. And he also gave me his wife’s homemade food. So a very nice drive back home!
Not much traffic, but still got picked up very quickly and straight to Tartu.
Just around sunset, hitched a ride back very fast.
Very nice spot, me and my friend got a ride in under 3min.

Towards Keila/Tallinn, Madise, after the army camp, you can hitch just anywhere on the road, good odds of getting picked up by drivers and quite some long distance cars as well, friendly people, wait times of 5-15 minutes expected

Towards Kloogaranna, you can use either the entrance of this road or the bus stop, both look good. Good visibility and not the highest of speeds around here, as well as more traffic than earlier parts of this road, wait times of 5-20 minutes

Towards Muraste, I'd use this patch of sideroad as there's a really wide asphalted side on the road for the houses by the side of the road, which is very comfortable for drivers to stop to, as well as u have good view from cars coming from Tallinn direction, the bus stop a bit further up is frequented with local busses, has usually lots of people in them as well as foilage is skewing the view, this here is a rather ideal spot, wait times of 5-20 minutes expected
Perfect spot for going towards Tabasalu/Muraste/Vääna-Jõesuu etc, wide enough bus stop that is not used by the busses after a roundabout, what else to wish, wait times of 5-10 minutes expected

Towards Abja-Paluoja/Karksi-Nuia/Valga. Low to medium traffic, but it's 70km/h area, I'd advise against hitching further west as the bus stop is in a rather bad spot and before that the 50km/h area is on  the hill with curbs, so I'd walk over here where there is clear view, probably wont stop a lorry here, but loads of longer distance smaller cars, wait times of 5-15 minutes
Towards Lihula, 70km/h area and decent enough visibility, I'd advise staying here rather than the bus stop which is awkwardly just after the hill, wait times of 5-20 minutes expected, low traffic
Was quickly picked up by a guy driving to Tallinn on a Sunday morning.

Towards Koluvere/ Risti-Virtsu highway. You can either stay in Laukna with lower speeds or walk a bit further outside to catch cars mostly going to Virtsu direction, low traffic, but most likely one of the first cars will pick you up, wait times of 5-30 minutes around here depending on traffic density

Bus stop towards Hageri/Kohila, it's inside the city limits so 50km/h, quite some traffic and wide bus stop, loads of people go just to Aespa, but you'll likely catch a car going to either direction within first 25 minutes.

Towards Saku, there's a small pocket for cars to stop to, you can also just hitch next to the road, most cars here will go to Saku, perfect for going there, just right amount of traffic, speeds are 70km/h and good visibility, wait times of 5-20 minutes expected

Do you want to go to Finland and have experience of the lifetime? If yes, this is a place for you. Stand by the gate to the pier, there is only one and every boat owner need to come through it. Now just ask if somebody is going to Finland and maybe you will be lucky as I was. 
Few tips: 
Good weather helps
On Friday and weekend plenty of people are going to Finland and back 
Summer is prime time
Looking clean is useful 
Absolutely majority of boat owners don't wake up before 10 am.
Have y
Got dropped off here, good to continue further on towards Tartu
Best spot around, enough space to spot and u dont need to walk that long

I added this spot 'cause maybe it's the best to stay on the road to Tallinn if you come from Narva and the car you're in turns or stops.
After, the speed of the cars increases
The cross makes plenty of space
Towards Risti, good visibility, high speeds but there's decent amount of space for cars to pull over, wait times of 10-20 minutes expected
Very wide onramp towards east direction on the highway, large enough for even trucks to stop, good visibility, wait times of 10-20 minutes expected
the spot is very far from the city but almost all of the cars are heading towards Rakvere. i didnt wait long
bus stop direction Tallinn
bus stop direction Viljandi
Many cars that go to the Latvia. We talked to 3 drivers and found a drive almost to Riga
Nice place to catch rides to Pärnu direction.
Quite fast traffic but the cars do have room to stop and you are nicely visible. Be it luck or good weather or something else, first passing car put the brakes on full block for me.
Perfect for heading towards Kohila/Tallinn, all the traffic from Rapla uses this road and due to roundabout the speeds are very low, works at nighttime too, wait times of 5-15 minutes to be expected

Towards Türi, good spot, just stay after the roundabout, most likely you'll get a ride immediately, Paide-Türi is used constantly no matter whats the season, time of the day etc, wait time of around 5 minutes to be expected
There isn't really any roadside but since low traffic cars can just stop after the roundabout, perfect for going towards Käravete/Aravete, wait time of 5-10 minutes to be expected
Great bus stop towards Tapa direction, good traffic, lots of locals tho, expected time of 5-10 minutes
Towards Kobela, don't go too far from center since locals tend to speed out from Antsla, here the speeds will be still low, decent visibility, okay traffic, wait time of 5-20 minutes
Towards Antsla and Võru-Tõrva road, very good visibility, low traffic but most likely one of the first cars will pick you up, wait time of 5-20 minutes expected
Great spot towards Urvaste, okay amount of traffic, still town area so speeds are slow, cars might also turn from Kanepi teepiirkonna tee, wait time of 5-20 minutes expected

Bus stop towards Kanepi, locals from Põlgaste will most likely go there so try to aim for them, but most likely one of the first cars will anyways stop, low traffic, wait time of 5-20 minutes expected
Towards Ahja, still decent traffic, nice view and speeds are still quite low, wait time of 5-20 minutes
Bus stop towards Ahja direction, good traffic and view for the cars, wait time of 5-20 minutes

Best spot for going out of Viljandi towards Tartu, cars come slow from turn, just be between the roundabout and Valuste road turn since if you go too up, you'll start bothering cars turning. Wait time of 5-20 minutes expected.

To get out of Koeru, most likely one of the first cars will stop, a lot of cars from here go straight towards Rakke, Tamsalu, Väike-Maarja so very good for that, but also just to get to Piibe highway(39), wait time of 5-10 minutes

Towards Koeru, very good bus stop, speeds are super slow which means that one of the first few cars will stop, however the road doesn't get too much traffic so you might need to wait some 10-20 minutes depending on the time.

Great bus stop for Keila/Tallinn direction, if the local bus is about to come might have people there so you can walk along the road, it's 70km/h area so cars are slower, expected wait time of 5 minutes
A bus stop. Two girls were heading to Saaremaa!!! So I was very lucky and no one checked the passenger tickets, so I got a free ride across with the ferry!

More local traffic, but some people head from Rapla to Tartu, so I was counting on that (as I personally like to take this route with my car to Tartu). Walked from the centre of Rapla to here. A couple stopped and took me from here to all the way to Tartu with a quick stop in a graveyard in the middle of Estonia where they planned on stopping and I had no problem with that as I just wanted to be home by the evening.
Nice and easy spot for cars to stop. It’s a bus stop. Got a straight ride to Tartu from here.

This is so far my best, fastest and coolest experience in Estonia! So an undercover/secret service agent who was on a mission to drive towards Ida-Viru, took me, even though he was in a hurry, as they had just captured some criminals that needed to be interrogated there. He had done hitchhiking himself when he was younger and that’s why he had stopped. So he told me that he’d get me to Tartu very fast and that he will speed and he cannot be fined (going waaaay over the speed limit lol) as it’s a
A bus stop where a judo coach stopped and took me across to Viljandi and even took me a bit further to a bus stop so I’d have a good chance to get from there straight to Tartu.
Very easy to get a ride to Häädemeeste. First car stopped.
Long straight road towards Värska, mostly locals going there,  you'll get a ride there fast, within 5-10 minutes

Towards Põlva, you can get here by going through Poldrijärve hikeway which is a bit more nicer than just walking on the road if coming from Ülenurme, decent traffic, wait time of 5-15 minutes, you don't need a specifc spot honestly in this road

Pretty nice spot going north, cars take this route to Tartu sometimes as an alternative to the Viljandi one so decent amount of long distance cars, as well as locals, speeds here still 50km/h, wait time of 10-20 minutes

Great for going to Lauka or nearby villages, but don't get fooled by the road name, if you are interested going to Käina or anywhere south, go to Kärdla and from there to Käina, as almost noone uses this road to get there, if going to Lauka, 5-20 minutes to get a car
Good spot for going either direction, cars from Hellamaa turn to Kärdla, wait times of 5-20 minutes depending on time
It's a bit uncomfortable as uphill and not the biggest bus stop as well as speeds getting up already, but people tend to stop here still and wait times not usually more than 15 minutes
Very good spot either direction, wait times of 5-10 minutes
Great spot for heading towards Käina, speed is 50 km/h til the end of the cemetery, wait time of 5-20 minutes
Great spot for going towards Emmaste, not the most dense traffic, but you'll get a ride within the first cars, wait time of 5-20 minutes
Great straight road, with good for going both towards Emmaste or towards Käina, wait time of 5-15 minutes
Great spot towards Männamaa, it has wide shoulder and parkinglot and low speeds from turn, first or second car will most likely pick you up, wait time of 5-15 minutes
Good straight road to hitchhike to Vaemla, lots of cars at summer, during winter it has medium share of cars, touristic area, wait time of 5-20 minutes

Decent spot just after the roundabout, but I'd recommend walking a bit more out from Käina, it's uncomfy for cars to stop here, however the wait times usually 5-15 minutes unless deep into the nighttimes
Great spot for going towards Kärdla, this road in general is good anywhere, also the most used road in the island so you will have quite some cars almost all the time, wait time of 5-15 minutes

Welcome to Hiiumaa, the best area for hitching in the whole Estonia in my experience, here go a bit further down from the bus stops, there's 2 lanes for a long time and just wait until a ferry comes, you'll most likely get a ride but be specific where you wanna go,  wait time; whenever the next ferry comes

Towards Narva, pretty nice bus stop where speeds arent that high but also away from houses, good visibility, lights at crossroad at nighttime make it easier for you as well, just be aware that borderpolice might check you (you are allowed to hitchhike so no worries)

There's a small road going to the riverport here, speeds are down, good for going towards Narva-Jõesuu, wait time of 10-20 minutes, lots of traffic, but be aware of borderpolice, they might check you (you are allowed to hitchhike so don't worry, it just goes about all this general area in Narva)
Towards east, nice visibility and speeds are still at 70km/h i believe, there's traffic coming from both the sideroad from Sillamäe and also from highway, waiting times around 5-15 minutes

Pretty good bus stop, long speeding up lane earlier, you probably should stand somewhere in middle, (unless on rain), not many cars coming from Oru so keep your eyes on highway, but since it's nice straight part drivers seem to speed a lot in this part, waiting time of 5-25 minutes
Good spot, I always try to catch cars coming from Jõhvi instead of the ones on highway, stay on ramp, there's driveways to the houses and decent amount of width, wait times of 5-20 minutes
Towards south, wide bus stop, good visibility and since there's settlement here there isnt too much of a speeding going on here, low traffic in the evenings, wait time of 5-30 minutes
Very good spot if headed towards Vasknarva, lots of cars and small speeds, however most cars go somewhere between, lots of locals, wait times of 5-20 minutes
Towards Rakvere, really nice spot, local cars take you on within 5-15 minutes, lots of traffic

Towards Aravete, but either direction really great spot, long straight actual former runway for soviet airplanes so the widest road possible, nice visibility, at winter very slippery area, otherwise great, waiting times of 5-35 minutes
Towards Tallinn, nice small spot, a bit more traffic since closer to capital, wait times of 10-25 minutes
Good spot for going towards Aravete, but not too many cars, also this area gets very slippery at winter so be careful, waiting time of 10-30 minutes
Good spot if going south, first or second car will most likely pick you up, not a lot of traffic, wait time of 5-20 minutes
Not much traffic but first or second car will stop, direction Põltsamaa, waiting time of 10-2o minutes
Nice bus stop, not too much traffic but cars from the sideroad turn usually towards Jõgeva and will pick you up, wait time of 5-20 minutes
Towards Jõgeva, try to aim for the cars coming from Tartu since noone will turn on this junction, doable both summer and wintertime, waiting 5-50 minutes
Still 70km/h here, lots of traffic, especially summer since everyone just comes from the beach from here, waiting time to Tartu 10-20 minutes
Long downhill from Lähte, it's harder to hitchhik in Lähte than here towards north direction, waiting time of 5-25 minutes
Long straight part towards Kärevere, not too many cars but they are likely to pick you up, wait time of 5-20 minutes
Main spot when I go towards Jõgeva, not the fastest, but lots of cars this way, average waiting is 10-30 minutes

Great spot if headed to Põlva or southbound, cars are very slow and lots of bigger villages around this road, don't be scared by its small roadstatus, it still gets decent amount of traffic by estonian standards. (if a car goes to Ahja try to convince them to drop you here), wait time 5-15 minutes

Bus stop towards Räpina, lots of local traffic, but the cars stop pretty nice here, better than on the roundabout, sometimes the stop isnt plowed the best at wintertimes but will still do the trick, wait time of 5-20 minutes
Long straight road towards Värska, not a lot of traffic, but the cars pick you up, also hitchhikable at winter but not in dark, waiting time of 5-20 minutes
Pretty nice spot if headed towards Tartu, especially cars coming from Vastse-Kuuste, its wide enough there to stop and will work both at summer and winter, wait time of 5-25 minutes
Side of the road is pretty wide and as all cars turned towards here, speeds are slow, cars towards Luhamaa or southbound stop pretty nicely here, waiting time of 5-20 minutes
Good roundabout for either direction, north or south, not too many but also not too little cars, so just perfect to stop cars here, waiting times of 10-20 minutes
Very good gas station, almost all of the refillers are headed to north or farther away from Võru, great odds of finding a right car or lorry within 10-30 minutes
Good junction to head to Võru, however you should walk a bit south from it, drives will have clear view, waiting time of 5-25  minutes
Great area to go to Otepää, most likely first or second car will pick you up, lots of local traffic and the density of traffic is quite sparse, waiting time of 5-15 minutes

Been here many times going towards Tartu, cars slow down before turning and 90% of them will turn left, will do even at nighttime or at winter, once even locals from house next to the spot gave me a ride to Tartu, waiting time of 5-30 minutes
Really great spot if headed to Tartu or Tallinn (lots of summer enjoyers from north estonia in here during that time), not the widest, but reasonable bus stop, waiting time 5-20 minutes
Towards Võru, you can hitchhike here or walk a bit further down the road, it will have the same effect, wait time of 10-20 minutes
Also pretty nice bus stop, again lots of local traffic towards Tartu, wait time of 10-25 minutes
Pretty nice bus stop towards Valga, lots of traffic, wait time of 5-25 minutes
Towards Tartu, great spot, not the longest of ramps but well visible, no streetlights for nighttime tho, but lots of local traffic to Tartu to combat that, wait time 5-20 minutes
Slow traffic, not that much of it, but wait time towards Valga is about 10-2o minutes
Towards Kilingi-Nõmme, pretty good spot, lots of traffic, unless at nighttime, wait time of 10-25 minutes
Towards Pärnu, good spot, lots of cars coming from Viljandi, nice ramp, waiting time of 5-25 minutes

Best spot if headed to north from Viljandi, cars coming from the 49 will have very slow speeds, and so will the ones coming from viljandi, harder at winter or at dark times as minimum lightning but in overall 10-60 minutes of a wait
To Tartu, pretty easy to get a ride from here, 50km/h area, cars being slower cuz of junction to right on a hill, as well as wide bus stop, (most cars will head to Tartu from here) time 5-20 minutes
A bit better bus stop towards Viljandi, most cars from onwards will be headed there, wait time 20-30 minutes
Towards Tallinn, nice visibility in 70km/h area, as well as cars coming from Kärkna might also go quite some way to north, waiting time 5-2o minutes
For some reason there's a bit muddy but wide roadside nearby this river when headed towards Tallinn, and cars have good visibility, no lights at dark, waiting time 20-30 minutes

Towards Tallinn, if the car is going to Puurmani ask to get out in this bus stop, trust me, you don't want to get stuck at Puurmani junction,
here however there's straight road and speeding camera just after the bus stop, waiting time 10-20 minutes usually
Towards Tallinn, pretty nice spot, still in 70km/h area, will get a ride within 30 minutes
Good spot if headed to Tartu, waiting time's usually at 10-30 minutes

There's a bus stop here, direction Tartu, it's fine, better than the stops at Mäeküla imo, there's speeding camera downhill before that so drivers are quite aware of the surroundings, waiting time 15-40 minutes
Towards Tallinn, not as long speeding up lane as in other direction, but still very good, most cars from Paide will head to Tallinn, wait time 10-20 minutes
Good spot if headed south, unless you will go at night, quite some traffic coming from Paide as well as cars from highway, long shoulder, wait time 10-30 minutes
Towards Tartu, on highway but good visibility and if you get stuck there's bus stop nearby, wait time 5-15 minutes
Lots of local traffic but most cars will go to Kose or Kehra, which are both good places to go to, speeds lower cuz of the corner on the road before and then straight  way, wait time 5-20 minutes

towards Tallinn, good spot, but you gotta walk here, there's not many cars joining from here so your best bet is the cars from highway, decently long speeding up lane and fair visibility, wait time 10-40 minutes
Around here onwards good to hitchhike towards Kernu, low traffic, but cars will pick you up within 10-20 minutes, you can just keep walking on this road if u wish to, here it's still 50km/h though
Nice junction with most cars going long distance, towards Tartu, waiting time 5-15 minutes
towards Tartu, in the middle of the nowhere on highway but people will stop, waiting time 5-15 minutes, you can get here by crossing Vaida bridge
Pretty good spot for going south, lots of vans or lorries turning from here, wait time 20-30 minutes
Not the best but pretty decent bus stop for going towards Koluvere, wait time 20-30 minutes
Direction Koluvere, not a lot of traffic, but still quite some, I'd recommend just hitchhiking on the road, the roundabout isnt the best imo in Märjamaa, wait time 10-20 minutes

Old Pärnu road, nowadays quite touristic area, really nice for hitchhiking anywhere along the road both directions, you'll get a car to Ikla or to Häädemeeste pretty fast, not too much traffic outside of the summer, wait time 10 minutes (anywhere on this road)
Lazy man's way to Pärnu, cars will pick you up within 10 minutes
If headed towards Tõstamaa or south from here, best spot at daytime, lots of local traffic headed there, 10 minutes wait time
Good spot towards Pärnu, you'll have cars coming on the road already sped up but first or second car from Lihula will take you most likely to Pärnu, wait time 10-15 minutes
Towards Lihula, good spot, still speeds are down, you can also be a bit further on the road, wait time 10 minutes

Towards Haapsalu, really nice spot, you can stay here or in the bus stop a bit further down the road, little traffic but I have always gotten literally 1st car to pick me up and get me to Haapsalu/Rohuküla, wait time 5 minutes

Good bus stop, direction Haapsalu, since besides Padise there's not many places left on the road, you'll have lots of longer distance traffic, (well not lots of, it's smaller road) but you'll pick up a ride rather fast, 10 minutes, also convenient store nearby
Pretty nice spot on direction Haapsalu, since Padise is the last bigger settlement before Linnamäe, most cars will head far, not much traffic, but you'll get one of the first cars, 10-20 minutes

Decent bus stop, not much traffic, but the cars pick you up good, honestly really nice road towards Keila/Tallinn, my recommendations as alternative to the Haapsalu highway, way prettier, and takes as long as the other road ;D, wait time 10-20 minutes

If you get a car to Linnamäe and are headed towards Keila/Tallinn, then just walk along the road, not much traffic so no worries, there isnt any particular place that stands out as the best spot, the 2nd or 3rd car will pick you up anyways and get you at least to Keila, wait time 20 minutes
Very nice bus stop for direction Haapsalu. Good at all times, night, winter, always gotten a ride within 10 minutes (lots of locals going to Haapsalu)

Best spot on the road for heading towards Haapsalu, short walk from the port, always local traffic headed to Haapsalu picking me up, may take long since not much traffic but never had to wait for more than 5 cars to pass, doable even in rain

This or anywhere on the following straight part of the road is pretty good when headed towards Rohuküla, most cars are going there on this road by this point, 10-20 minutes of wait time usually, unless late in the evening
Another nice bus stop towards Rohuküla, usually 10-15 minutes waittime

Good bus station, nice for cars coming from Männiku road, but also you can hitchhike anywhere after the Haapsalu central bus station towards Rohuküla, not that much traffic and friendly people, usually 10 minutes
There's infotable and speed 50 km/h after sharp turn, pretty good place to hitchhike towards Rohuküla, a car within 10 minutes when you are going on the popular ferry times
Probably best spot headed to Tallinn from Haapsalu, but even then it takes 10-30 minutes to get a car usually, still in city limits but no shoulder, don't get fooled by cars turning to Tennise :D
If feeling lazy it's good spot for Haapsalu, locals will pick you up fast
Good spot for heading towards Tallinn, rides come within 10-15 minutes, it has a shoulder as well as 70km/h if i remember correctly
Great spot towards Haapsalu, long straight road and 50km/h lasts for quite some time, rides usually come within 10 minutes
Great little bus stop, helps against rain as well, good for getting towards Haapsalu, wait time 10 minutes, (people will generally think you just missed your bus and are willing to help)
Decent little bus stop towards Haapsalu, but also the other direction is good since there's speedcamera just behind the bus stop, 15 minutes usually
Good long straight part of the road (direction Haapsalu), no shoulder but good for stopping cars nevertheless, 10-15 minutes

Best spot imo headed towards Haapsalu from Risti, tho a lot of the cars coming from Risti don't go far, you'll get a car already on the main road to stop within 10-15 minutes, not hitchhikable at nighttime sadly

Usually I walk here from Risti, it's a good long straight part of road, cars will stop within 10 minutes, there's also Rehemäe bus stop a bit further down the road, which is decent but its just before a corner as well as fast downhill before so I'd recommend this spot better (direction Tallinn), wait time 10 minutes
Good spot for heading to Haapsalu, but only during the daytime, wait time 5 minutes
Great spot for Haapsalu direction, good visibility during daytime as you are down in valley, if possible try to get here instead of Riisipere crossroad (from my experience) wait time 5-10 minutes
Nice little bus stop, behind the curve towards Haapsalu is a speedcamera so drivers are usually already down at 90 km/h, gotten ride always within 10 minutes
Bit awkward area, but a lot of longer distance traffic, you can just walk by the side of the road thumb up and will likely get a car within 10 minutes, (direction towards Haapsalu)
Great spot for heading towards Tallinn, you'll get a car usually within first 10 minutes, also hitchhikable late at night

Best spot on the Haapsalu highway (headed towards Haapsalu), always got a ride within 20 minutes, usually just couple minutes, speeds are low, 50km/h area, good visibility and most traffic is headed at least some distance

Walking along road with thumb. Long straight, 3rd car stopped, quite low traffic so they stopped on road. Was a tiny bit difficult explaining where I wanted to go for some reason, but in the end they where very kind. Microscopic English but Google translate convo happened.
Walking along road with thumb. Very little traffic, but first car stopped! Took me to lighthouse. Kind driver, almost zero english but Google translate worked. Cool wooden church nearby.
Wandering along road with thumb. First car stopped (not much traffic though). Driver spoke basic English, enough to have simple conversation, and was a cool dude. Got to next junction.
Very little traffic, but the first car stopped. English speaking tourist going to the main road. A fun ride! Just walking along road with thumb. Lots of cool ruined bunkers in the area.

Got off the ramp and stood there with thumb. Nobody could see me, so stand more visible further back, but there was a pullover place. As the last cars left, somebody called me over and took me halfway across the island! Driver spoke very good English.
Aldo it was raining I still managed to get a ride
Aldo there is not much space to stop for drivers I still got ride even though it was raining
Even though it was raining and it was pretty late in the evening i still managed to get a ride
Even though there was raining a little bit and it was pretty late time I still managed to get a lift south

Roundabout before ramp to Pärnu. Great place to get to forward and even to Riga.

Drivers will see you already from other side of roundabout and there's space to stop to side of the road. I went there during evening so I beleive it's even easier during the day.
Usually around 5-15min of a waiting time.
lot of traffic, cars go pretty slow and plenty of space to stop. found a direct ride to Tallinn after a while.
Tallinn direction, amazing spot, even at dark you'll get a car within a hour usually, you can get here by Tartu city bus that goes to Kannikese stop and then walk, waiting time 5-50 minutes
Lots of traffic, mostly going to Tallinn
Average waiting time for a couple 10 minutes, for a guy 20 minutes and for a girl 5 minutes.
It was already dark, but still managed to catch a straight ride to my granny’s place!
Super good spot, plenty of space for cars to stop, I guess we just got unlucky and no one wanted to stop. There is bus stop with roof to hide from rain.
Plenty of space for cars to stop. On my way to Riga
Best spot if headed south, will get a car within 20 minutes ( don't go anymore further south since they built new highway with 120 or 110km/h

Indeed a pretty good spot for going any of the directions past Aovere (Jõhvi/Kallaste), loads of traffic and good visibility, the bus stop is pretty wide also, place has street lights but during low traffic hours might take some time, wait times of 10-40 minutes expected
Got a ride straight to the bog I wanted to go for my geocaching adventure hehe.

You can easily get here from Tartu city centre with a bus (also for free as I do, if you dare). A lot of people drive in the evening from Tartu towards Mustvee or even Jõhvi, so I’ve hitched a ride from here to my friend’s place several times and had no problems getting a ride even straight to the place I wanted.
really okay spot to go to riga
Even on a quiet day with little traffic I only waited 30 minutes.  Great spot for both directions.
To north and to south. Perfect spot, lots of cars and trucks. Plenty of space.

Decent spot for heading towards Tallinn, usually you'll get a car within 30 minutes, you could also try the Jaama tee turn but there'll be lots of local traffic headed towards Riisipere or similar areas, now there's also a gas station next to it, but mainly used by locals or people coming from Tallinn
we (three persons, mixed gender) wanted to go the the islands (the port rohuküla); the first car stopped and offered to the other port (virtsu), forth car stopping went to our destination
Good place to get a ride to Haapsalu, since there is space in the bus stop and all the cars from Tallinn to Haapsalu come through it

Towards Põlva, quite some traffic and due to the turn the speeds are very low, wouldnt recommend at dark but otherwise a very good spot, loads of locals take this road to Põlva, wait times of 5-20 minutes

Towards Tartu, not a lot of traffic around here, especially after dark, mediocre lighting, there's cars coming from Mooste, but half of them go the other direction or towards Põlva, wait time of 10-30 minutes
A Georgian in a LT car stopped, and took me to Tallinn from here with a coffee and snack stop in between.
Another decent bus stop if headed to Tallinn, however wait times still go up to 80 minutes

Towards Pärnu, loads of traffic, very good visibility, quite a wide bus stop with a shelter for the rain. Wait times of 20-60 minutes expected, but due to the high likelyhood of getting a long distance ride it's worth the wait, also with cars turning from Varbola, you'll most likely pick one of the first of them (usually they head to Märjamaa, where you can continue further south)
Decent spot for Tallinn direction, but wait times are quite long in this stretch of the road, 40 minutes or more

I didn't walked until there, from haapsalu it's not usefull, you've got a bus stop just after the bridge, and then there is a lot of space to stop on the side of the road for a long distance,i stayed in front of the fas station (empty) for very little time
Not a lot of cars headed far, fair place still for hitchhiking towards Lihula, wait time around 40 minutes
Had to wait for a while, but eventually got a ride till Riga.

Awesome Lithuanian truck driver picked me up immediately from the rain, was heading to Vilnius. I hopped off in Panėvežys. The man was very helpful and just generally epic, he offered me water-coffee grounds-mix and crystalized ginger. Had "Rīga" on a sign.
Towards Luunja, less traffic, but still doable, you'll get a car within 30 minutes
To Tartu, pretty nice quiet road, with lots of locals headed there, more used at summer, waiting time of 5-15 minutes

Not too busy on a Sunday morning, but a nice bus stop and the first car took me across to the other side of Viljandi, after he had dropped his child off and then took me to Kõpu as he had time and wanted to help me a bit further.
Small bus stop towards Viljandi, not too much of a traffic, but its 50 km/h area, waiting time 20-40 minutes
Enough space to stop 3 trucks
Ride in 5 mins to meteor crater. Driver spoke no English but was very kind and willing to use Google translate. Good space to pull over, good visibility, traffic slow from roundabout.
Best place to get back from Islands and Kuressaare. You can wait a little just because there are not a lot of cars on Saaremaa
i got a ride to the mainland easily
friendly tourist
Not much traffic, but after walking here from the border I got a ride in minutes straight to Tartu.
Best spot if headed north, a lot of local traffic but it's good spot almost 24/7 and no matter is it winter or summer, wait time 5-20 minutes
After walking hours from Valka, passing next to a military exercise on the border, I ended up casualy on that spot and it worked directly !
I should be a good one, but it was Sunday afternoon and there weren´t many cars. Anyway it is the right spot to Tartu.
to Tartu. I usualy use this spot to hhike to Tartu. But maybe there is better one?:)
I stood just before the bus stop/gas station. Perfect spot for Tallinn. Sign highly recommended though. Fairly slow speeds for such a big road and good visibility.

Perfect spot to ask around and get a direct ride to Tallinn. I literally even didn't finished writing my Tallinn sign, when a kind woman came to me, pointed at my unfinished sign and said that she could give me a lift to Tallinn

You can stand directly on the road after the traffic light. Because of a construction, cars were forced to stay on the left side of the road, which was a bit unfortunate, but if that is gone, it will probably be better.
Maybe i am lucky, but literally first truck took me to latwia-estonia border
Got a ride to Pärnu just a few min after I got dropped here :D
Small parking lot before the intersection

Good spot no problem
Here you have all the cars from Narva

direction Tallinn and Tartu. If the driver is going in a different direction than you, ask to be dropped of in Johvi, cause thats where the two main roads collide. Not a lot of space to stop but a lot of traffic.

Good place for going out from Narva, the only viable in my opinion, it has decent lights but roadside is quite muddy as well as there's gonna be turnlane for right, waiting times gonna be depending on season and time from 10-50 minutes
a local woman offered me a ride to Rummu even though she wasnt going there. overall a good spot to tallinn direction

Going to Tallinn?
Bus #2 takes you to the point.
Or 2km walking from centre.
Car to Tõrva stopped in 15 minutes, fine place for car to stop.
Good spot if headed to Tartu, low speeds, decent bus stop, wait time of 5-20 minutes
To Tartu / Tallinn
Actually has a very long speeding up lane from traffic from east, great spot for south, wait time 10 minutes
we almost got desperate about the speed of the traffic...
to Riga. you get the traffic from East Estonia too!

Moved here from the other spot next to the Sillaotsa bus stop (waited there 2,5h). From here I got a ride in 10min directly to Ikla (Estonia-Latvia border). Stand next to the motorway at the traffic lights, use a thumb preferably.

16 Jul 2025
Waited 5 minutes twice (includes Sunday at 8am in October) straight to pernu once and the other time riga
I was hitchhiking right in the LAAGRI bus stop, and it was a good place because after 15 min. I got a ride towards Parnu by 2 estonian nice ladies! :]]
Good spot at the bus stop. Got a ride from there after just 10 or 15 min

ALTERNATIVE way - take any bus to Laagri and walk for 10min to the place (after crossing the railway). 
Waited around 30min to get to Parnu.
Many spots along the road at the border you can stand and get cars. I stood right after the border before the first building. Plenty od space to pull over.
There were not so many cars at the gas station, so after a while we went to the street and hitchhiked from there.
Very good spot, slow driving and plenty of place to stop but still waited 45min.
I got a ride in 5 minutes with a "Wherever" sign.
good place to stand, right after the border, lot of space for cars to stop

I think there is not need to walk further to leave Tartu
It's a bus stop

To Mustvee, JÃµhvi and Narva
wide road, good visibilty, 50-70km/h speeds. Road is ready since 2007, it's not under construction.
Towards Haapsalu, little traffic but cars have barely any speed due to turn, sooner or later a car going towards there will pick you up, wait times of 5-35 minutes expected
To Haapsalu or Rohuküla, where you can board ferries.
Not a really good spot, higher speeds and by now most right lane turns soon away, wait times 60+ minutes

Right after the lights
Everyone see u while turning around the corner or staying on the light

Coming from Tallink line. Wasn't lucky enough to get a ride before we arrived. Passengers are directed away from the car traffic through bridges, and you won't have enough time to walk to where the cars exit before they finish. Was lucky that a Viking ferry was arriving just half an hour later, so I headed to the better spot next to the roundabout.

Spot to leave from the little walk in the swamp
The cars are going very fast, however it's a large bus stop so i didn't waited long, but i didn't liked very much the place
Very good spot for going towards Tallinn, lots of cars both from highway and from Loksa coming, waiting times of couple minutes to 15 minutes
Good spot towards Pärnu, cars going slower on highway as well as the ones coming from the gas station, wait time 10-20 minutes

70 km/h area, headed towards Tallinn, it's decent but may take up to hour to get a ride, for a plus it has a hut in bus  stop so good for rainy days, as well as hitchhikable at dark (which cant be said that much about the stop on the other direction)

Not the best spot (direction Haapsalu), after bus stop there's also way turning to gas station but gas station is mainly used by locals from Riisipere area, speeds are down at 70km/h but still I'd personally try to walk further towards Riisipere manor bus stop, you'll get a ride still within a hour so not the worst either
I arrived here from Tartu by HH and I need to wait one hour for the next car ! Maybe because I don't look European hahahaha
To Latvia. Great spot, high speeds but tons of room for them to see you and stop.
Towards Narva, okay amount of traffic, we were able to catch a car whilst walking down the road, would expect wait times of 15-30 minutes

Very crappy dirtroad(!) with very low traffic, but people do visit their datchas at the end of the road and if you happen to walk back when they happen to drive by, since their speed is at around 20km/h it is almost guaranteed they would stop and pick you up so therefore you would have a guaranteed ride to either towards Sillamäe or towards Narva, wait times of 20-40 minutes

Towards Auvere, there is a wide shoulder here after turn where cars can easily stop, but the road doesn't get the most amount of traffic so you can also try to walk and thumb the cars, half of the traffic here is made by lorries as well which are unlikely to stop, that head to Auvere, wait times of 30-40 minutes expected

Towards Tartu, quite uncomfy for the cars to stop but there's not much options around here, try to aim for those rare cars turning from Jõgeva, locals though usually go the other directions, good visibility and does have street lights as positives, wait times of 20-45 minutes expected
Towards Kõrveküla/Aovere, okay amount of traffic, has street lights and wide bus stop, a good way to skip Tartu and try to get a car further on the Jõhvi highway, wait times of 10-30 minutes
Towards Rõngu, not the ideal bus stop but 70km/h area and wide enough for cars to stop, as well as good visibility, wait times of 10-25 minutes expected

Towards Elva/Valga, during lower traffic hours, you can use this area where two lanes go into one, and the following old driveway which is now blocked off, wouldn't have much hope on rush hours here but otherwise wait times of 10-30 minutes expected

Towards Vastse-Kuuste, local traffic only headed towards there, you could also try hitching anywhere in Lootvina, this is the first area on the road where you'll actually have some traffic however still wouldnt expect a car faster than 20 minutes, realistic wait time of 20-40 minutes

Towards Tartu, uncomfortable spot as its on the turn but cars on the highway don't speed as it still is 70km/h area or just about ended as well as some cars from Sangla would turn, with no speed, so all in all you'll get a car within 10-30 minutes, wouldn't recommend at night time
Towards Linnamäe/Haapsalu, fine bus stop, but little traffic, good visibility, and first sensible spot since Jalukse, wait times of 15-40 minutes

Towards Linnamäe/Haapsalu, very low traffic as well as most cars already on the Keila-Haapsalu road would speed, but there's some traffic turning from Risti road headed towards Linnamäe or Nõva which you should aim for, bus stop is okay, not the largest but will fit a lorry if needed, wait times of 20-50 minutes

Towards Värska or Võru, if you have a ride that only takes you to the trainstation area etc, you can try your luck at catching a car on the Põlva roundway, ask for Rosma, if the car is headed to other direction than you, as you would skip Põlva then, decent amount of traffic, a bit uncomfortable for drivers to stop, you can just walk along the road, beware a lot of cars turn to Põlva or to the factories so don't be hesitated by that, i'd only try this at daytime, wait times of 20-60 minutes expe
We started walking slowly towards the bigger road, but hitched a ride despite not much traffic straight to the place were we left our bikes near Tartu.
There are probably better spots further, but I still got a ride to Kuivastu from here.
I was walking, as there was not too much traffic, and just hitchhiked straight on the road, but still got a ride to Rannapungerja.

Towards Keila-Joa, pretty uncomfy spot, but due to the build of the road drivers slow down here and since you are basically in the middle of nowhere, they are more likely to help, very low traffic, wait times of 20-60 minutes expected, try to aim the cars to the Rannasüdame bus stop

Tested my luck trying to go around Pärnu, quite a long speeding up lane from the Maksimarket, good visibility and speeds are low, tho a loads of cars around here will just enter Pärnu, within 30 minutes someone will feel bad and stop for you, but the odds of that car going to Tallinn are small and for Ikla even smaller. Might be worth to have a sign, I would rather recommend taking the city busses

Towards Lihula, Pärnu. During the ferry times (when cars come off from the Hiiumaa ferry), you can try to catch cars going to Pärnu direction on this road, as they all take the Valgevälja road to skip Haapsalu, during that time it is perfect, you can stand anywhere on the road, but outside of that the road has no real usage so quite useless outside of the "golden rush". Wait times of 5-minutes when ferry cars come, otherwise I'd recommend walking to the bus stop a bit further
did jumping jacks for attention worked would recommend
To Rakvere/ south further, good road, you can thumb anywhere, not too much traffic but one of the first cars would pick you up, wait time of 5-20 minutes expected
Good for heading towards Tallinn - wait of 10 minutes, quite some cars take this road, not that much traffic headed towards Jõelähtme for that direction you definitely need to walk to the roundabout

Small bus stop towards Maardu, if you come from Tallinn you can also try the roundabout but a lot of cars turn to Muuga so I'd recommend just walking here if you are headed towards Maardu as a lot of locals use Kaldase road to come from Muuga, wait times of around 10 minutes to be expected
Towards Keila/Tallinn, even though there isn't really much space by the roadside, the cars still stop quite often just outside of Rummu
Microscopic traffic (obviously) but helpful people, every fifth passing car stopped while I held a thumb up walking to east
Not much of a traffic going towards Rapla, you still might get lucky with odd long distance drivers but mostly locals around here, wait times of 5-25 minutes expected depending of the time

Fine spot going towards Roosna-Alliku, okay traffic but that's about it, the cars on road have high speeds and there isnt really a speeding lane or anything here, but locals from Aravete tend to go to Ahula/Kaalepi area the least, wait times of 10-30 minutes expected
Pretty fine spot towards Tapa, locals mainly, okay traffic, you can also use the turn to go south towards Assamalla/Väike-Maarja, good visibility for cars, wait time to be expected in 10-30 minutes
Decent area anywhere in Hulja to get towards Tapa, okay roadsides, pretty fine traffic, locals mainly, wait time of 5-15 minutes expected
Decent bus stop towards Pärnu, try to aim for cars turning from Surju, wait time of 10-30 minutes expected
Towards Kanepi, low traffic but speeds are slow, not a lot of space to stop for cars but it's fine, wait time of 5-25 minutes expected
Small road towards Põlva, you'll get a car within 20 minutes but low amount of traffic
Pretty wide bus stop towards Viljandi, good traffic, but drivers tend to speed, wait time of 10-30 minutes expected
Wide roadside, decent amount of traffic, you can be here with just a thumb but sign makes life easier, directions for Võhma/Viljandi, wait time of 20 minutes
Bus stop towards Jõgeva, pretty decent spot, low speeds, medium traffic, wait time of 20-25 minutes expected
Since Siimusti turn doesn't really work nor inside Jõgeva I have started to use this inbetween area, which usually works within 30 minutes if headed to Tartu direction

Fast traffic, some space for cars to stop. Luckily I got a ride with a local man working in Finland heading back home to Kuressaare and he had no problem taking me all the way to Roomassaare sadam to catch a ferry across to Abruka. He even showed me around the city a bit with his car. I managed to arrive to the harbour two hours ahead of my time, but luckily the captain accepted my story of hitchhiking here and took me across with the earlier ferry.
Towards Koeru, good visibility for cars to stop, the road has little traffic so the cars stop more likely, but wait times can be 5-20 minutes depending on the time of the day
Towards Koeru, good spot, wide road with 50km/h, but little traffic, mostly locals, wait time of 5-10 minutes
Towards Räpina, great spot, all the cars are slow, but traffic density is little, lots of locals, wait time of 10-30 minutes

You can hitchhike anywhere in Värska, it's all 50 km/h and the side of the road is pretty nice, direction to Saatse, wait time of 10-40 minutes since very low traffic, mainly locals, beware to take id-card or passport since the border guards might check you
Pretty nice long straight road in 70km/h area, but little traffic besides summertime, try to not get here at dark, wait time of 5-20 minutes otherwise usually

If your destination isn't Lepiku village then go this road (if you don't want to walk to Emmaste), most cars even going to Emmaste will go north following 12132, rather than take the shorter Lepiku road, wait time 20-30 minutes, not a lot of traffic
Little traffic, most cars to Sarve use the other road but you will still have a car every 10-20 minutes that will likely take you aboard

Alternative for when no ferry, there's still locals sometimes around this carpark or near the smaller boat port, also there's storebus that comes by here, where locals might be at, you might not get a ride far, but you can get a car to a place that has traffic outside of the ferrytimes

Towards west, decent spot, but bollards make it annoying, also I wouldnt recommend staying here during rushhours, it's pretty uncomfortable spot for cars to stop, but you'll get a ride at least to Kohtla-Järve within 5-20 minutes when traffic density is a bit slower
Towards Kohtla-Järve, it is actually a decent spot, nice wide bus stop but mainly very local traffic and seems most cars go somewhere around Lüganuse, wait times of 10-30 minutes
The junction to Rakvere/Järva-Jaani/Jõgeva, decent for any direction, but may take some time, 10-50 minutes
The only decent place for going for the highway up north, waiting times 10-30 minutes
On a highway, when not too much of a traffic it's easier to stop cars, wide shoulders, waiting of 5-20 minutes
Fine spot towards Tallinn, lots of traffic that direction, but will take still 20-40 minutes for a ride
Decent spot towards Aravete, but not great place for cars to stop, low traffic, wait time of 20-40 minutes
Towards Tartu, not ideal, lots of local traffic, but people pick you up, waiting time of 10-40 minutes
Pretty nice spot for Põltsamaa direction, little cars but usually they will pick you up pretty fast, bus stop is wide but at winter gets muddy and ugly, wait time of 5-60 minutes
Okay spot but not too good for a car to stop, average waiting time of 20-40 minutes towards Jõgeva
Pretty hard location for car to stop but locals seem to be helpful, direction to Jõgeva, waiting time of 10-25 minutes
Just start walking from Kärkna and keep your thumb up for all the cars, there's not much traffic but quite some from northern Tartu headed to Tallinn this road, waiting time will be 10-40 minutes
After the closure of the Russian border the traffic has dried up, will take quite some time to get a car towards Latvia, waiting time of 20-30 minutes
Better, only minus since there's very little amount of traffic, good for going south towards southern villages, waiting time of 20 minutes, also doable in winter

Very little traffic, mainly just people who visit Piusa ( you can just go and ask there in parking lot as well) but usually 1st or 2nd car picks you up and gets you further south, waiting time of 10-20 minutes
Not the best place, just walked along the road, lots of traffic southbound, wait time of 10-25 minutes

A bit harder towards Tartu, either the bus stop or immediately after Kambja but its pretty difficult place to stop for cars either way, I'd recommend just walking to Otepää junction, here you can still get a car but within 20-50 minutes

Decent spot tpwards Tartu, but all the cars from Sooru will turn towards Tsirguliina so keep your eyes for cars coming from south. Also at nightime there's zero lights, so be prepared for that, wait time 20-60 minutes
Decent place towards Viljandi, straight road, but not the comfiest place to stop, wait time of 15-45 minutes
Better spot if headed towards Viljandi, however still quite some local traffic, waiting times 20-40 minutes
Decent spot towards Tallinn, but not comfortable for cars to stop, waiting time of 30-70 minutes to be expected
Not a good spot in general but for some reason has worked out for me with wait times of 5-20 minutes

to Tartu, not the best after the addition of safety island, but walk a bit further and it's pretty decent place, or you could also try gas station nearby, both would get you wait time of around 30-60 minutes
There's bus stop and also parking nearby, not the best area on the road, hard for cars to stop but usually you'll get a ride within 60 minutes (towards Tartu
Good spot if headed towards Ojasoo (also the 2nd roundabout is really good for that), if headed towards Tartu or Tallinn, walk to the highway, wait time to Ojasoo 10-20 minutes
Decent spot for going south, lighting at dark, however not the best one, depending on time and season, 20- 60 minutes
Another good junction on the highway, perhaps least used out of this direction (towards Tartu) but you'll get a car from highway within 10-30 minutes
Not many cars coming from this exit but traffic on highway will stop, towards Tartu, wait time 10-30 minutes
Towards Tartu, on highway but cars do pick up quite fast here, wait time 5-20 minutes

Decent bus stop, direction south, but you want to walk a bit further up from the bus station since it gets secluded from highway, slower traffic can stop from right lane, have gotten lorries from here, wait times around 10-30 minutes

Actual spot here, towards south, pretty good location, hard to get here tho, cars coming from roundabout will sooner or later stop, the lights here are old style so not the best visibility at nighttime, wait times around 10-5o minutes

At nighttime have hitched here many times, towards Viimsi, all along Pirita tee, especially the area before Rummu tee, is pretty good, all but one time I have gotten a ride, usually within 20-30 minutes, ( i use buslane for standing since no busses at night (unless friday-saturday)
Nice shoulder towards south but no cars really coming from it so gotta try to get a car from highway (it's 100 or 110 km/h on there) so it may take some time, 20-70 minutes
Decent spot on highway, if headed towards Märjamaa, walk a 100 meters away from the point, to Märjamaa 10-30 minutes, to Risti or to Lihula depending on the day 10-50 minutes
If headed towards east, you'll get a ride, but it will be mostly local traffic, not good road for nighttime as not many good spots for cars to stop or lights, wait time 30 minutes

Used to be good spot for going south, right now it still has a bus stop, but now it goes a bit off from the road, you can try hitchhiking on shoulder before that, will take before 10 minutes, now probably around a hour to get a ride
Not the best spot for Lihula direction, but you'll get a car within 30-40 minutes, but might get local ones as they think you missed your bus

If you make it here just before Hiiumaa ferry, it's the best spot, (in the port bus station the busses stop so I wouldnt recommend there too much), during ferry time you'll get a car definitely but otherwise try to walk towards Eigla bus stop
Decent spot, but cars tend to not stop here when there's tourists checking out the remains of the castle, without any other cars parked nearby you'll get a ride to Haapsalu within 20 minutes

At nighttime a bit better to stay closer to the road and roadlights, otherwise try a bit further down the road, I only use this spot when it's dark or really late with not much of traffic, will get a car within 30 minutes usually
Small road on side going to forest, not the best spot for Tallinn direction, takes 30  minutes for a car, just shortly after the city limits
Not the best spot for going towards Tallinn, takes usually 40 minutes, here there's still quite a lot of local traffic (most headed towards Linnamäe or Taebla)

Decent bus stop towards Tallinn, i'd walk tho a bit further down the road towards Taebla (before speedcamera where its long straight road), wait time in bus stop around 40 minutes, on the straight road 20 minutes
Crossroads, it's decent both directions but better towards Haapsalu, waittime to there 30 minutes, towards Tallinn 60 minutes

direction Haapsalu, not that good of a spot, as most already have gotten up their speeds and most cars from either roads, Lihula highway and Risti itself turn towards Tallinn, I usually walk to the next road from Lihula which has way longer speedup way, here it's 30 minutes at least

It's good spot towards Tallinn during the daytime, at dark you'll need to wait for cars coming from Lihula which may take some time, pretty nice tho even deep in the winter, wait time depending on the season 10 minutes to 90 minutes

Last decent bus stop before Risti (others are quite pointless ones) still may take quite some time to get a ride towards Haapsalu, not much light after dark here so you might want to get yourself a bus after the dark (it has connection with Haapsalu) wait time 30min to 2 hours
Nice little bus stop, good during the daytime, wait time around 5 minutes
Kanama bus stop, it's decent, better likelihood to get a car from here as the cars headed towards Saue have left, still usually takes 20 minutes at least for a ride

The best spot going Pärnu/Haapsalu direction nearby Tallinn, usually I get a ride within 30 minutes, however can take up to 2 hours, decent spot in all weathers and times, however a lot of cars will pass by really fast, try to aim for the ones coming from Laagri stores
Ok spot, on a bus station
Moved there from different spot and it was much better. Cars have more space to stop and lot of cars drive slowly to the gas station.
A lot of cars

Waited here for 2,5 hours, got no lucky. One Polish truck stopped for me after ~30min, we had no mutual language but couldn't apparently take me. After walking to the other spot next to the Nõlvaku bus stop, I got a ride in 10 minutes. So I'd rather recommend that spot.

16 Jul 2025
Great place easily accessible by public transport. Older couple in camper van took us to Parnu.

Lot of local cars, no trucks at all. After 60 minutes car stopped ant took me to Kaunas (I was so lucky)
I thinks its better to go futher.
2 lane road, hitch at the bus station. Got a ride to Pärnu after 60min. Cars go medium speed. But only 1 lane able to stop.
Last Sunday I waited in the dark for 30minutes, this time 15min and both times I luckily got a ride straight to Tartu.
got stuck here wouldnt recommend

The best spot if headed towards Tartu, traffic light before and you can get here with bus nr 2, however it still takes tons of time to get a car, usually wait time 30-120 minutes, on plus side, it's pretty good lightning at nighttime here, and road is clean of snow at winter
Great spot and tons of cars. Includes local traffic too though. Took the number 2 bus from the city center.
Best spot to Tartu: bus stop after the traffic light, comfortable place to stop cars
Bus stop before exit to Kunda. I was there in the morning with sign 'Tallinn', so not many cars were going that way. Got a ride after 35 minutes or so to the Lahemaa national park
direction Kunda

Very good spot towards Tapa, decent traffic, speeds are slow due to roundabout and very wide road here, wait time to be expected 5-10 minutes, mostly locals, some people use Viitna exit from highway to head towards further south to Väike-Maarja etc so also doable for that direction, or use the turn in a kilometer or so
direction Parnu
No success. Nice, sunny day. Not many cars, but noone stopped. Took a bus further north (Tiksoja stop), where we were lucky.
Not a lot of traffic car, but we were lucky to get a ride straight to Tallinn.

Considering the modest size of Tartu (100k inhabitants) and less then optimal time of day (early afternoon), I'd say an hour is a decent result. Plenty of space for cars to stop, unfortunately not much traffic (at least not on early weekday afternoon).
A bus stop on the road to Tallinn. Considerably less local traffic and less people walking around than on the stop further south.
Middle of nowhere, but a lot of cars
Probably one of the poorer areas, as it's a bit too close to Ääsmäe, around a hour to get a car
Very good spot either direction for rainy days also, you can stand under the bridge and try to hitch cars from highway and those entering also (if direction Tallinn), wait time of 10-20 minutes
Cars go really fast but we got lucky after about 30 min. with a car taking us to Parnu.
Ok spot towards riga, cars arent too fast, plenty of place to stop

Towards Ikla/Kilingi-Nõmme, in idea the spot looks good, bus stop after the new highway turn, loads of cars in slow speeds, but in reality noone wants to stop here, wait times of over 1 hour definitely to be expected, also local drunks may be fooling around the Ülejõe Selver area. Alternative idea is the Scania service center just behind you, I did manage to find a lorry going a long distance in couple hours time, so might be worth the shot, as asking around there may be way better than just sta
Good if you are in Northern part of PÃ¤rnu, trying to get to Riga, Latvia

Towards Jõhvi, rather poor bus stop, pretty small and cars tend to speed on this straight part of the road, road itself has annoyingly little sides before the ditch so your best bet is to just get lucky, I would recommend staying a bit before the bus stop so people can see you hitch and then see the bus stop and go there, would recommend not coming to here, wait times of 30-70 minutes expected

Towards Viljandi, kinda okay spot, but has a bit annoying stone bollards before the bus stop that are rather annoying for drivers, not the best visibility as well as cars tend to speed through here, bus stop itself is very wide, try to aim for cars turning either from Tusti or from Uusna, wait times of 30-70 minutes expected

Towards Rasina (but the same goes to Ahja direction also), barely any traffic, very little cars, you can just hitch anywhere along the road, you'll have a car pass you once in half a hour etc, wait times of 20-60 minutes
Towards Tartu, long straight road with good visibility, possible to stop small cars during the day time, wait times of 30-80 minutes
Not the best spot, but still some room to pull over.

Towards Keila-Joa, in theory perfect spot, wide bus stop, 50km/h, turns from either side, but in reality 75% of the traffic turns to Vääna-Jõesuu so almost noone continues driving further, as well as those that do, half of them go only as far as Naage, as I got an offer from a local lady to there, u might get lucky as the spot is amazing but wait times of 30-80 minutes are more realistic

Towards Kernu, one of these roads with no point in staying in particular spot due to how little cars use this road, loads of truckers headed to the nearby quarry who can't stop. So your only shot is to catch some locals, which can be quite hard depending on the time of the day, wait times of 20-80 minutes expected

Towards Kiisa, Kohila. There's a small driveway after the roundabout but it is rather uncomfy, not a lot of space, also the tree foilage is quite near the road. Lots of short distance drivers and people generally seem to not want to take you here cuz there's loads of busses around here. Wait times of 40-80 minutes expected, not suitable for the dark time

Towards Jõgeva, a little convenient bus stop, however the visibility is rather poor due to guardrails and road bends, speeds are fast and cars deem this bus stop too little to stop, in the end you can try your luck walking further towards Kaarepere and hitch on the way, here waiting time estimates at 40-80 minutes

Bus stop on a long straight road. Small traffic out of the town. We were thinking of going after the crossroad but we catched a ride fast. Before we tried on Metsamaja bus stop for 30+minutes and were not succesful.
not a great spot because cars go fast there and the bus stop is behind a turn. i got lucky though and found a direct ride to Narva. its the best bet if youre heading east from Rakvere i think

Towards Roosna-Alliku, Ahula is lowkey a dead spot on this road, not much traffic anywhere, speeds are okay, 70 area i believe but people tend to speed through, good visibility but main problem is the lack of cars going any distance, wait time to be expected around 30-40 minutes
Okay bus stop towards Tsirguliina or Tartu-Valga highway, cars come from around the corner tho and traffic density is low, wait times of 10-40 minutes expected
Towards Jõgeva, you can be either in the Koeru crossroad or walk a bit further, either way there's barely any traffic, wait time of 30-40 minutes on average
Bus took me for free

Towards Tartu, even though it's 50km/h and it has lights it may take quite some time to get a car, most cars are locals since more of Ahja people go towards Räpina or Põlva, wait time of 20-50 minutes, bus stop isnt that big, but decent enough for a car to stop more conveniently
Very little traffic, but people do take this road as a shortcut towards Kõpu, but try this road only during summer and daylight time, waiting time of 10-40 minutes
Shortcut road to Kõpu, but only take it during the daytime, as its sparsely driven, 1st or 2nd car will tho most likely pick you up, wait time of 10-20 minutes
A bit worse bus stop but in case of a rain it will do the job, otherwise i'd walk a bit further, there's still cars turning away from here or towards Hirve, wait time of 40-70 minutes

Towards Tallinn, not the greatest, they added bollards to the middle not so long ago, which makes it more uncomfortable for cars to stop, sideroad doesnt get much traffic, lights at nighttime tho so good for that, wait time of 20-80 minutes
Towards Aravete, curvy road, not too much traffic and hard for cars to stop, time will be 30-70 minutes
Even tho the spot looks great, cars dont want to stop here, nice visibility and just 90km/h, waiting times of 40-90 minutes
Uncomfy for you but doable, speeds still slow, direction Tartu, time 40-80 minutes, no traffic late at night

Finally first somewhat decent spot on a road since the last estonian cars usually turn from this junction leaving you only with LV, however really little traffic, waiting time of 20- 40 minutes here but anywhere else on the road more than 60 minutes for sure

You can hitchhike anywhere on the road towards Võmmorski, since the border being shut for most traffic, there's barely any cars, 1 in every 10 minutes to be lucky, someone will eventually stop but enjoy the nice walk around, wait time of 30-80 minutes
Not a lot of traffic headed toward Räpina, might take a long wait if hitching here on not so popular hours, bus stop itself is small and not the most comfiest but over the time you'll get ride
Used to be better, nowadays rarely cars stop here, speeds are fast and a lot of traffic turns towards Põlva, if headed to Võru, waiting time of 30-40 minutes
Alternative one to Tartu, but honestly no match to just walking 400ms or so north, waiting here would be a hour or so
As always, at winter almost impossible, but fine spot at summertime, wait time 10-120 minutes (winter), you can also take a bus to Puhja from here. Not a lot of cars and those cars are all local
Towards Puhja, pretty harsh road, especially during winter, during summer you'd get a ride within 30 minutes, but during winter it could take hours
Small parking southbound but only advisable to briefly stop if some car actually is there to try to chat, otherwise I'd go to Lemmatsi junction, not really cleaned nor used during winter

If headed towards Haapsalu or Risti, don't hitchhike inside the town, but walk further past the park of the manor, there are way better odds of getting a car, here it'd take up to 2 hours, also not much of traffic here after 7pm
Towards Viljandi, it's pretty hard spot nowadays, but cars are slow, waiting time around a hour
Very uncomfortable spot for cars to stop, if you are already here walk a bit further towards the Kardla road, here you might wait hours
Gas station but mostly used by cars headed to Tartu or nearby areas, still can give it a shout, wait time 30-60 minutes
Towards Tartu, fair spot, but not as good as the earlier ones, also at nighttime no lights, so beware of that, waiting time 10-30 minutes, at night can be up to couple hours
Not that used gas station, lots of local cars, you'll have higher chances on the road, wait time 30-90 minutes
If headed towards Saue/Saku, decent spot, otherwise 1/5 if headed south, right lane goes down to Jüri roundabout, speeds go down to 70 or less, wait time around 20-60 minutes

Decent spot during daytime, more of at mornings, when not that much of a traffic is going southbound, long speeding up lane, however as per usual for this part of the highway still long wait times, 40-80 minutes
If you miss the bus, might try to hitchhike towards centre, doable but hard, 1 out of 4-5 times works within 20 minutes

Direction Tallinn, pretty hard spot, not much lighting after Taebla and speeds go up to 90km/h again, can work at daytime but waittime is around a hour, when its nighttime stay more towards taebla center, between the safety island and the house

Long speed up way but not much cars coming Tallinn direction from Palivere, usually need to get a car from the mainroad, however that takes a lot of time, 30-100 minutes, also the road doesnt get cleaned that long during wintertime so prepare for that

There is a turnoff here with a long space to pullover. Good visibility. The traffic was fairly low but OK. A lot of people where turning at the next junction and many people where going so fast they didn't slow down, so it was a longer wait than the rest of the island, but got picked up after 45 mins. The driver was very kind, he spoke a very tiny amount of English and was happy to use Google translate to estonian.

There is space to pull over for the cars going off of the Tallink ferry. I got a ride to Riga quite quickly but I got the feeling that a lot of drivers going on the highway don't actually pass here. To get a ride it might be better to either choose the other spot that is marked on the map or to walk 200m further north to the junction there. (Female, daytime, summer)
Ok spot to hitch to Latvia, loads of cars but also includes local traffic. Some space for the cars to stop before the bus stop and enough time for them to see you. Took the bus number 2 to get here.
Bus stop Pirita Jogi. Stood with Narva sign, got a ride after 15 minutes. Merging lanes, cars already go too fast. Guess I just got lucky
not a great spot, cars go fast and there are several lanes. i got lucky and got a ride to Tapa after a short while.

Towards Rakvere, very hard spot, cars merging from several lanes and speeds are quite high already, right lane mostly goes to Loo circle so honestly I'd recommend taking a bus and going a bit further, wait time 60+ minutes

Towards Tartu, don't know why, since the spot looks ideal (low speeds, speeding up lane, as well as good visibility) but for some reason can't ever get cars here, my Estonian antirecord of wait times has been here, even has great street lights for the darker times, but seems like mission impossible, genuinely wait times are 100-250 minutes in here, would probably recommend going to Tartu through Ahja or Mooste road, good luck
